Title: N/A

reviewText: This film has great acting by Vincent Cassell and all suuporting characters, great story-telling & directing.  Gerard Depardieu is a very scary gangster!  However, the Director seems to assume that the audience already knows the story (I had never heard of Jacques Mesrine before), and gives away the ending at the start of the film!  How much more intense and exciting the last 15 minutes of Part 2 would have been had the outcome not been revealed at the start of the film!  That extremely poor editing choice makes an otherwise great film much less so!  Even with real characters, there is a vast audience that does not already know the story, and it would have played out much, much better in normal sequence.  The other minor complaint is that some of the sub-titles flashed on the screen for such a short time that I had to back track and pause to see what was said on 4-5 occasions.  That said, the acting is so good and the directing so good, that I still recommend this film.  I do not think some of the reviews are of this particualr set.  This is a excellent print and high quality DVD package.  The quality of the transfer itself is excellent, with a CD of the Soundtrack and CD of the Music in additon to both Parts of the film.  Compared to the price of getting both films separately, the price is reasonable as well.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Handsome-Jeff Friedberg, an Author and Media-...
reviewText: Loosely based on fact. In brief, part 1 was mesmerizing, and part 2 was not, until the slam bang ending. All of the acting was superb, and all of the actors have great faces and expressions. Great photography and solid directing. Mesrine is suitably maniacal but not comprehensible in his actions except to say that he does it because he's a maniac. I recommend this dark, violent, blood soaked movie series. (written on my touchy, hateful iPad.)
summary: Yes and No, Great and Just OK

reviewText: Discovered this great movie as a trailer for "Girl with Dragon Tattoo" and could not stop watching the trailer! Found this region free four disc dvd/cd on Amazon...and boy howdy, I was not disappointed!! This French film (in two parts) is AWESOME!!! Why can't they release a region free blu-ray? This DVD has outstanding picture quality (anamorphic 2.35) and awesome sound (French with English subs)with plenty of bass. Got this under twenty bucks and by looking at other prices now, glad I took advantage of the fantastic bargain!! This movie puts "The Godfather" to shame. BRILLIANT!!! Get it while you can...
summary: Now THIS is a gangster flick!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow!This is one of the best Gangster flicks in a long time.The story told here  is  after the true life story of the real french gangster Mesrine and his assorted compagnons(one of them was Michel Ardouin who also acted as advisor on the set to guarantee the authenticity and truth of this biographic material..),the main character ,brilliantly played by Vincent Cassel.He seems to be getting better and better.I always liked him and thought that he was truly one of the modern great actors.So much passion and really convincing.He's outdoing himself here...(you might also wanna check out:"Blueberry"-a somewhat surreal and even psychedelic western made after the comic character created by french superstar Moebius/Jean Giraud,or "the Crimson Rivers" with Jean Reno,a superb and nailbitingly exciting crimestory..)Ah well,Europe is still better than Hollywood in so many ways,more realistic...This movie is full of good action,sex,character development and starts in Algeria where Mesrine served in the french army.It ends with his death many years later.Gerard Departieu appears as Crime lord Guido and a Matthieu Almaric as Mesrine's companion(for a while..)-very good acting.So,get it while you can and enjoy.There are similarities in the story with another noteworthy european flick that came out last year and plays around the same time:"The Baader-Meinhoff Gang",the true story of a mayor terrorist gang in Germany that kept the country in upheavel for  most of the 70's.Worth watching too if you are into these kind of movies...
Title: N/A
